meanings.definition: An exclamation expressing surprise or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: Lawk! I didn't expect to see you here!
meanings.sent2: Oh lawk, that magic trick really surprised me!
meanings.sent3: When the clown popped out of the box, everyone shouted 'lawk'!
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of fireworks overhead made the crowd exclaim 'lawk' in unison.
meanings.sent5: As the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, the audience gasped and said 'lawk'.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily scared or startled.
meanings.sent1: My little brother is such a lawk, he jumps at every little noise.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was too much for the lawk sitting next to me.
meanings.sent3: The lawk screamed when a tiny spider crawled across the table.
meanings.sent4: She's a lawk when it comes to haunted houses, always running out in fear.
meanings.sent5: The haunted hayride was too intense for the lawk, who closed their eyes the whole time.

meanings.sent1: I lawked when the cat suddenly jumped off the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Don't sneak up on me like that, you always lawk me!
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder made me lawk and spill my drink.
meanings.sent4: She lawked at the sight of the spider crawling up her arm.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected noise in the dark alley made him lawk and drop his keys.
